intro: Parantennaria, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that often appear in clusters, giving it a ghostly appearance. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Parantennaria species are often found in regions of southern Africa, where they have adapted to harsh, dry conditions. Their botanical features make them an interesting subject for study in plant adaptation and ecology.
